description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S73a) to vary Condition 12 (delivery and servicing plan)) and Condition 13 (delivery and collection times) of planning permission ref: 164015FUL dated 20/04/2017 (as varied by 173955VAR dated 28/02/2018 and 185939VAR dated 28/06/2019) for: Redevelopment of the site to provide a 5-22 storey perimeter building to accommodate commercial floorspace at ground floor (mixture of Land Use Classes D2, A1,A3 and B1) and 302 residential units, amenity space at 1st, 5th and 9th floors, car and cycle parking, refuse storage, vehicular access to the east of the site, landscaping and lighting. Variation seeks to amend conditions 12 and 13 to allow deliveries to service the new store on Sundays and Bank Holidays.

| Each new non-residential element of the development shall be registered with Building Research Establishment (BRE), achieve BREEAM Rating Very Good and make reasonable endeavours to achieve Excellent (based on the latest BREEAM Technical guidance).
(A) the non-residential element of the development shall be implemented in accordance with the BREEAM details approved under Ref: 230826CND dated 24 April 2023.

(B) Within 3 months from the date of first occupation of each non-residential element of the development, BREEAM 'Post Construction Stage' Assessment and related Certification verified by the BRE, should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming the BREEAM standard and measures have been implemented.

Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the BREEAM Very Good or higher standard shall be retained in working order for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: In the interests of addressing climate change and to secure environmentally sustainable development in accordance with policies SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan (2021), and the relevant guidance notes in the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance 2020, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012.

| A) Within three-months of the first occupation of each residential and non-residential component within the approved development, Energy Performance Certificates [EPC's], detailed modelling output reports showing clearly the DER/BER and TER from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures should be also submitted for written approval by
the Local Authority.

B) renewable/low carbon technologies within each residential and non-residential component of the approved development shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under Ref: 222340CND dated 1 July 2022 and permanently retained thereafter.

C) Prior to occupation of the development including residential and non-residential components, the approved development shall incorporate, maintain measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 36.02% (equal to 197.1 tonnesCO2/yr) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved
Energy Statement Addendum Rev E (27 October 2017) and supplementary information (29 October & 02 November 2017) prepared by Method Consulting.:

i. energy saving measures to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 12.7 tonnes CO2 equating to 2.31% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the compliant BR Part L 2013 base case.

ii. incorporation of onsite gas fired Combined Heat & Power (CHP) of at least 33kWe/66kWth, if connection to an offsite heat network is unavailable, to provide at least 72% space heating and hot water to all dwellings and hot water to the non-residential units and achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 177.4 tonnes CO2 equating to 33.19% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the Be Lean case.

iii. incorporation of at least 12.6kWp solar PV system to generate at least 13.64MWh/year electricity and achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 7.08 tonnes CO2 equating to 1.98% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions savings over the Be Clean stage of the Energy Hierarchy.

D) Measures to reduce the carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (un-regulated) should be incorporated and maintained in line with approved Energy Statement Addendum Rev E (27 October 2017), supplementary information (29 October & 02 November 2017) and Sustainability Statement Addendum Rev A (07 August 2017) prepared by Method Consulting and Sustainability Statement Rev 2 (04 August 2016) prepared by Hodkinson Consultancy.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.
